meanings.definition: Attempted to explain or justify behavior or decisions
meanings.sent1: She rationalised her actions by saying she had no other choice.
meanings.sent2: He always rationalised his decisions before taking any action.
meanings.sent3: The cat rationalised knocking over the vase by claiming it was in the way.
meanings.sent4: Her mind rationalised the fear as a mere illusion.
meanings.sent5: In his speech, he rationalised the importance of honesty in relationships.

meanings.definition: Made more efficient or cost-effective by reorganizing or streamlining operations
meanings.sent1: The rationalised process saved time and resources for the company.
meanings.sent2: The new system was much more rationalised than the old one.
meanings.sent3: The kitchen became a rationalised space after the renovation.
meanings.sent4: His rationalised approach to work impressed his colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The rationalised production line increased productivity significantly.
